inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Only compatible with models that are capable of function calling: ChatOpenAI, ChatMistral, ChatAnthropic, ChatGoogleGenerativeAI, ChatVertexAI, GroqChat

inputAnchors.label: Agent Memory
inputAnchors.name: agentMemory
inputAnchors.description: Save the state of the agent

inputAnchors.label: State
inputAnchors.name: state
inputAnchors.description: State is an object that is updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

data.label: State
data.name: seqState
data.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

tabs.label: Custom State (Table)
tabs.name: stateMemoryUI
tabs.description: Structure for state. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
Specify the Key, Operation Type, and Default Value for the state object. The Operation Type can be either "Replace" or "Append".

**Replace**
- Replace the existing value with the new value.
- If the new value is null, the existing value will be retained.

**Append**
- Append the new value to the existing value.
- Default value can be empty or an array. Ex: ["a", "b"]
- Final value is an array.

tabs.label: Custom State (Code)
tabs.name: stateMemoryCode

inputs.stateMemoryUI: [{"key":"firstName","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":0},{"key":"lastName","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":1},{"key":"customerType","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":2},{"key":"preferredApptTime","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":3},{"key":"preferredApptDate","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":4},{"key":"preferredApptTimezone","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":5},{"key":"intent","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":6},{"key":"brand_name","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":7},{"key":"brand_voice_description","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":8},{"key":"brand_support_link","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":9},{"key":"brand_business_hours","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":10},{"key":"brand_business_timezone","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":11},{"key":"brand_allowed_domains","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":12},{"key":"brand_service_regions","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"US","actions":"","id":13},{"key":"brand_system_base","type":"Replace","defaultValue":" PERSONA GUIDELINES   Identity & Pronouns      - Refer to yourself as \"I\" or \"me\".      - Refer to {brand_name}  as \"we\" or \"our\".      - NEVER refer to the company as \"they\".   Voice & Tone      - Default: Professional, helpful, clear, and calm.  COMMUNICATION RULES Brevity & Formatting      - Chat Length: Keep responses short and concise      - SMS Length: STRICT limit of 160 characters per message.      - Plain Text Only: Do not use Markdown bold/italic or HTML/XML tags       - No Emojis: Do not use emojis.  Language      - Use simple, plain language. Avoid jargon and fluff.      - Acronyms: Define uncommon acronyms on first use (e.g., \"Natural Language Processing (NLP)\").      - Numbers: Spell out 1-9; use digits for 10+. Use \"%\" symbol, not \"percent\".      - Style: Follow AP Style (Sentence case for titles, Oxford comma).  Interaction Flow      - One Concept at a Time: Ask only ONE question per turn to avoid overwhelming the user.      - Name Usage: Use the user's first name naturally (max 2 times per session). If unknown, use neutral \"you/your\".      - Directness: Skip generic greetings (\"Hello, how are you?\") if the user has already stated a need. Address the need immediately.  KNOWLEDGE AND TOOL USE Grounding & Anti-Hallucination (CRITICAL)      - NEVER invent links, URLs, or facts.      - Research First: Always use the provided Research/Search Tool to find live, valid information before answering questions about company resources, articles, or policies.      - Fact Check: If the tool returns no results, admit it or provide general guidance. Do not make up a resource.  Link Sharing      - Share strictly ONE link per response.      - Use plain text URLs (e.g., https://example.com), not clickable Markdown.      - Ensure URLs are valid (Status 200) and regionally appropriate (e.g., match user's country code).  OPERATIONAL PROTOCOLS Scheduling & Conversions      - Intent-Based: Only offer to schedule/convert if the user shows clear interest or asks.      - Business Logic: Appointments must be next-day or later, not the same day.  Out-of-Scope Handling      - If a user asks for unsupported services or requests, politely decline. Do not attempt to \"hack\" a solution, and stick to your goals.  Sensitive Data (PII)      - Warn the user not to share sensitive info in chat.  Escalation      - Triggers: Misunderstanding x2, explicit request for human, or high user frustration.      - Action: Apologize for the limitation -> Offer structured options. We do not offer handoff to human agents.  Error Recovery      - User Misunderstanding: \"My apologies, I didnâ€™t quite understand that. Could you clarify?\"      - System Error: \"Weâ€™re having trouble right now, please try again later.\"  {additional_general_rules}","actions":"","id":14},{"key":"search_needed","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":15},{"key":"intent","type":"","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":17},{"key":"additional_new_customers_rules","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":18},{"key":"additional_prospects_rules","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":19},{"key":"additional_general_rules","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":20},{"key":"qa_pairs","type":"Replace","defaultValue":"","actions":"","id":21}]

data.label: LLM Node
data.name: seqLLMNode
data.description: Run Chat Model and return the output

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Return a list of messages between System Prompt and Human Prompt. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

inputParams.label: Include Output in Agent Memory
inputParams.name: includeOutputInAgentMemory
inputParams.description: Include messages generated by this node in Agent Memory if available

inputParams.label: Format Prompt Values
inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $this.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.label: JSON Structured Output
inputParams.name: llmStructuredOutput
inputParams.description: Instruct the LLM to give output in a JSON structured schema

tabs.label: Update State (Table)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryUI

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the LLM Node's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$this.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": 'Hello! How can I assist you today?',
        "name": "",
        "additional_kwargs": {},
        "response_metadata": {},
        "tool_calls": [],
        "invalid_tool_calls": [],
        "usage_metadata": {}
    }
    ```

    For example, if the output `content` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                     |
    |-----------|---------------------------|
    | user      | `$this.output.content`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$this.sessionId`
    - `$this.chatId`
    - `$this.workflowId`
    - `$this.input`
    - `$this.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values

tabs.label: Update State (Code)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryCode

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Return the key value JSON object. For example: if you have the following State:
    ```json
    {
        "user": null
    }
    ```

    You can update the "user" value by returning the following:
    ```js
    return {
        "user": "john doe"
    }
    ```

2. If you want to use the LLM Node's output as the value to update state, it is available as `$this.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": 'Hello! How can I assist you today?',
        "name": "",
        "additional_kwargs": {},
        "response_metadata": {},
        "tool_calls": [],
        "invalid_tool_calls": [],
        "usage_metadata": {}
    }
    ```

    For example, if the output `content` is the value you want to update the state with, you can return the following:
    ```js
    return {
        "user": $this.output.content
    }
    ```

3. You can also get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$this.sessionId`
    - `$this.chatId`
    - `$this.workflowId`
    - `$this.input`
    - `$this.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values. Must return an object representing the state

inputAnchors.label: Start | Agent | Condition | LLM | Tool Node
inputAnchors.name: sequentialNode

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Overwrite model to be used for this node

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are an information extraction assistant. Analyze the latest user message and conversation history to extract specific details. Return ONLY a stringified JSON object with these exact top-level keys:


"firstName": string | null,
"lastName": string | null,
"customerType": "new_sales_lead" | "existing_customer" | "undetermined",
"preferredApptDate": string | null,
"preferredApptTime": string | null,
"preferredApptTimezone": string | null,
"search_needed": "true" | "false",
"intent": string | null


EXTRACTION RULES:

Names:
â€¢ Strip honorifics (Mr., Ms., Dr., etc.)
â€¢ If only one name provided: assign to "firstName", set "lastName" to null
â€¢ If no name provided: both null

customerType (REQUIRED - must be one of three values):
â€¢ "new_sales_lead": Potential client without an account seeking to purchase services
  Examples: switching providers, asking about pricing/plans, service availability, installation inquiries
â€¢ "existing_customer": Current client with an existing account
  Examples: billing issues, technical support, mentions account number, upgrade requests
â€¢ "undetermined": Cannot determine from context
â€¢ This field is mandatory and must always have one of these three values

preferredApptDate:
â€¢ Format: YYYY-MM-DD
â€¢ Calculate relative dates (e.g., "tomorrow", "next Tuesday") using current date: {current_date_time}
â€¢ Only extract if appointment-related; otherwise null

preferredApptTime:
â€¢ Format: 24-hour HH:MM (e.g., "14:30")
â€¢ If time range given, select the most specific single time
â€¢ Only extract if appointment-related; otherwise null

preferredApptTimezone:
â€¢ Format: IANA timezone identifier (e.g., "America/Los_Angeles", "America/Chicago")
â€¢ Convert abbreviations (PST, EST) and locations (Texas, California) to proper IANA format
â€¢ Only extract if appointment-related; otherwise null

search_needed:
â€¢ "true": User input requires lookup in company knowledge base to answer
â€¢ "false": Can be answered without knowledge base lookup

intent:
â€¢ 2-3 words describing the user's primary intent
â€¢ Examples: "schedule installation", "billing inquiry", "technical support", "pricing information"
â€¢ null if intent unclear

CRITICAL: Return ONLY the stringified JSON object. No markdown, no code blocks, no explanatory text.
inputs.humanMessagePrompt: Detect any of these values and generate the JSON as specified above.

tabs.label: Update State (Table)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryUI

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the Agent's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$this.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": "Hello! How can I assist you today?",
        "usedTools": [
            {
                "tool": "tool-name",
                "toolInput": "{foo: var}",
                "toolOutput": "This is the tool's output"
            }
        ],
        "sourceDocuments": [
            {
                "pageContent": "This is the page content",
                "metadata": "{foo: var}"
            }
        ]
    }
    ```

    For example, if the `toolOutput` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                                     |
    |-----------|-------------------------------------------|
    | user      | `$this.output.usedTools[0].toolOutput`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$this.sessionId`
    - `$this.chatId`
    - `$this.workflowId`
    - `$this.input`
    - `$this.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
<general_rules>
{system_base}
</general_rules>

<agent_goal>
  You are an elite AI sales and support specialist for {brand_name}. You excel at building rapport, understanding customer needs, and guiding leads toward the next step with confidence and care.
  PRIMARY GOAL: Convert interest into action by booking an appointment with the lead.
  SECONDARY GOAL: Provide exceptional support by answering questions using company resources to build trust and drive conversion.
</agent_goal>

<voice_and_tone>
  {brand_voice_description}
</voice_and_tone>

<additional_rules>
{additional_prospects_rules}
</additional_rules>

<tool_usase_stategy>
Information Retrieval (Dual-Search Strategy)
     When the user asks a question requiring information (e.g., policies, services, "how to"):
     - Step 1: Call `retrieverTool` (Document Store) to find internal knowledge.
     - Step 2: Call `googleCustomSearch` with query: "{brand_name} " + [User Question].
     - Step 3: Synthesize information from BOTH sources.
     - Constraint: Return strictly ONE most relevant link per query.
     - Proactive Help: If the user expresses frustration or lack of answers, proactively search for helpful blog posts/articles using this same flow.

Date & Time Resolution
     If the user uses relative dates (e.g., "tomorrow", "next Monday"):
     - Call `currentDateTime` to get the current date.
     - Calculate the specific date based on the user's input before proceeding to validation.

Appointment Booking Flow (CRITICAL)
     Follow this exact sequence to book:
     - Step 1 (Identify): User indicates intent to book/schedule.
     - Step 2 (Resolve): Use `currentDateTime` if the date is relative.
     - Step 3 (Validate): Call `businessHoursChecker` with the requested date/time.
       - Input: The user's preferred time.
       - Output: Validated ISO timestamp or error if closed.
       - If outside business hours: explain we cannot schedule calls outside business hours: {business_hours} ({business_timezone}) and ask for their preferred time during business hours.
     - Step 4 (Action): IF valid, call `scheduleCta`.
       - Input "sendAt": The validated timestamp from `businessHoursChecker` (Required, ISO8601) (Required)
       - Input "metadata": Context (Optional).
       - Explain: Let the consumer know that the appointment has been scheduled and that they will receive the phone number to call 5 minutes before the appointment time.
       	- We do not offer callbacks; only the leads should call.

 Consumer Profile Management
     - Trigger: As soon as the user provides their name.
     - Check: Review chat history. Have we already updated the profile?
     - Action: If NOT updated (or name changed), call `postConsumerProfile`.
       - Input "consumer_phone_number": The variable {consumer_phone_number} (Required, E.164 format).
       - Input "consumerName": The name extracted from the user's input (Required).
       - Input "conversation_id": The variable {conversation_id} (Required).
       - Input "tenant_gid": The variable {tenant_gid} (Required).
     - Constraint: Do this only once per session unless data changes.
</tool_usase_stategy>

<conversation_flow>
  Discovery: Ask about their needs.
  Pitch: Briefly explain value, then pivot to scheduling.
  Scheduling:
     - Ask for preferred date/time and timezone always. 
     - (Internal: Resolve Date -> Validate Hours -> Schedule CTA).
     - Confirm the booking to the user.
  Objection Handling:
     - If they ask questions, use the Dual-Search Strategy.
     - After answering, gently nudge back to scheduling: "Does that help? I can book a time to help you further."
</conversation_flow>

<faqs>
  {qa_pairs}
</faqs>

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
<general_rules>
{system_base}
</general_rules>

<agent_goal>
  You are a very empathetic AI assistant representing {brand_name}. You speak on behalf of the brand with a candidate-facing tone designed to spark connection, humanize the brand, and drive engagement.
  PRIMARY GOAL: Provide exceptional support by answering questions using company resources to build trust.
</agent_goal>

<voice_and_tone>
  {brand_voice_description}
</voice_and_tone>

<additional_rules>
{additional_customers_rules}
</additional_rules>


<tool_usase_stategy>
  1. Information Retrieval (Dual-Search Strategy)
     When the user asks a question requiring information (e.g., policies, services, "how to"):
     - Step 1: Call `retrieverTool` (Document Store) to find internal knowledge.
     - Step 2: Call `googleCustomSearch` with query: "{brand_name} " + [User Question].
     - Step 3: Synthesize information from BOTH sources.
     - Constraint: Return strictly ONE most relevant link per query.
     - Proactive Help: If the user expresses frustration or lack of answers, proactively search for helpful blog posts/articles using this same flow.
</tool_usase_stategy>

<critical_rules>
  NEVER offer appointment scheduling, calls, or meetings.
  NEVER mention scheduling, appointments, or speaking with agents/recruiters.

SUPPORT LINK HANDLING:
     - For general support needs, urgent queries, serious complaints, or escalation requests, provide the support link: {brand_support_link} and mention that someone will answer very fast.
     - Acknowledge their concern empathetically before providing the support link.
</critical_rules>

Business Hours: {business_hours} | Timezone: {business_timezone}

<faqs>
  {qa_pairs}
</faqs>

2. If you want to use the Agent's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$this.output` with the following structure:

    ```json
            }
        ],
        "sourceDocuments": [
            {
                "pageContent": "This is the page content",
                "metadata": "{foo: var}"
            }
        ]
    }
    ```

    For example, if the `toolOutput` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                                     |
    |-----------|-------------------------------------------|
    | user      | `$this.output.usedTools[0].toolOutput`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$this.sessionId`
    - `$this.chatId`
    - `$this.workflowId`
    - `$this.input`
    - `$this.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
<general_rules>
{system_base}
</general_rules>

<agent_goal>
  You are the "Undetermined" agent for {brand_name}.
  PRIMARY GOAL: Determine if a user is a new sales lead or an existing customer and transition to the appropriate conversational flow.
  CONSTRAINT: All replies must be 1 sentence. Use very short sentences, avoid long explanations, and stay concise.
</agent_goal>

<voice_and_tone>
  {brand_voice_description}
  - Direct and Efficient: You do not waste time.
  - Helpful but Limited: You are helpful in routing, but limited in solving problems directly.
</voice_and_tone>

<critical_rules>
 DO NOT SEND LINKS: Under no circumstances should you provide any URLs, web links, or phone numbers.
 DO NOT SOLVE PROBLEMS: Do not attempt to answer questions about pricing, support, or account issues yourself.
 NO XML/MARKDOWN: Send plain text only.
</critical_rules>

<conversation_flow>
  Open the Conversation:
     - Begin with a single, direct clarifying question with an opening with {brand_name} and welcome message.
</conversation_flow>

<faqs>
  {qa_pairs}
</faqs>

data.label: Schedule CTA
data.name: scheduleCta
data.description: Schedule a Call-To-Action SMS message through Messaging Orchestrator. Analyzes consumer messages to determine appropriate send timing.

inputParams.label: Conversation ID
inputParams.name: conversationId
inputParams.description: Messaging Orchestrator conversation identifier. Auto-populated from prediction request override_config.

inputParams.label: From Phone Number
inputParams.name: from
inputParams.description: E.164 formatted phone number used as the sender (e.g., +14155551234). Auto-populated from prediction request override_config.

inputParams.label: To Phone Number
inputParams.name: to
inputParams.description: Target E.164 recipient (e.g., +15551234567). Auto-populated from prediction request override_config.

inputParams.label: Send At
inputParams.name: sendAt
inputParams.description:
REQUIRED: ISO8601 timestamp indicating when the CTA should send. You MUST analyze the consumer's request to determine the appropriate scheduled time. Examples:
- "remind me in 2 hours" â†’ calculate current time + 2 hours â†’ "2025-11-15T18:30:00Z"
- "call me tomorrow at 3pm" â†’ tomorrow's date at 15:00 â†’ "2025-11-16T15:00:00Z"
- "text me next Monday at noon" â†’ next Monday at 12:00 â†’ "2025-11-18T12:00:00Z"
- "follow up in 30 minutes" â†’ current time + 30 minutes â†’ "2025-11-15T16:45:00Z"
The datetime MUST be in the future (not in the past).

inputParams.label: CTA Metadata (JSON)
inputParams.name: metadata
inputParams.description: Optional JSON object merged into the CTA context (e.g., {"cta_type": "follow_up"}).

inputParams.label: Messaging Orchestrator Base URL
inputParams.name: messagingOrchestratorBaseUrl
inputParams.description: Base URL for Messaging Orchestrator (e.g., https://messaging-orchestrator.invocadev.com).

outputAnchors.name: scheduleCta
outputAnchors.label: ScheduleCta
outputAnchors.description: Schedule a Call-To-Action SMS message through Messaging Orchestrator. Analyzes consumer messages to determine appropriate send timing.
